original: @91b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @91b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: au gra t'a ra de w'i s'a dh'a nam /
analyzed: au gra t'a ra de w'i s'a dh'a nam /
translated: Ugratārādevīsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lha mo au gra t'a ra'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: lha mo au gra t'a ra'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining the Goddess Ugratārā

original: shes rab gsal byed au gra t'a ra la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: shes rab gsal byed au gra t'a ra la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Ugratārā, who illuminates wisdom.

original: 'di nyid kyi bsgrub pa nyams su len par 'dod pa'i gang zag gis //🔽gnas kyi khyad par /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bsgrub pa nyams su len par 'dod pa'i gang zag gis // gnas kyi khyad par /
translated: A person who wishes to practice this very means of attainment🔽should go to a special place,

original: ling ga gcig pa'am /
analyzed: ling ga gcig pa'am /
translated: such as a solitary place,

original: dur khrod dam /
analyzed: dur khrod dam /
translated: a charnel ground,

original: khang stong la sogs pa'i gnas su /🔽ro ma nyams pa'am /
analyzed: khang stong la sogs pa'i gnas su / ro ma nyams pa'am /
translated: an empty house, and so on.

original: bde ba'i stan la 'dug nas /
analyzed: bde ba'i stan la 'dug nas /
translated: Sitting on a comfortable seat,

original: gnas gsum du rdo rje gsum bsam par bya zhing /
analyzed: gnas gsum du rdo rje gsum bsam par bya zhing /
translated: one should imagine the three vajras in the three places

original: yi ge gsum las 'od zer 'phros /
analyzed: yi ge gsum las 'od zer 'phros /
translated: and imagine light rays radiating from the three syllables.

original: srid pa gsum po thams cad snang bar byas /
analyzed: srid pa gsum po thams cad snang bar byas /
translated: The three existences are illuminated.

original: slar tshur 'dus nas thim par bsam mo //
analyzed: slar tshur 'dus nas thim par bsam mo //
translated: Again, they gather back and dissolve.

original: de nas stong pa nyid kyi don bsam zhing /🔽aom sv'a bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a sv'a bh'a wa shuddhonyaham /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid kyi don bsam zhing / aom sv'a bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a sv'a bh'a wa shuddhonyaham /
translated: Then, one should contemplate the meaning of emptiness

original: zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhes brjod do //
translated: and recite:🔽Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ.

original: de nas stong pa'i ngang las nam mkha'i gnas su a'a: @92a * //
analyzed: de nas stong pa'i ngang las nam mkha'i gnas su a'a: @92a * //
translated: Then, from within emptiness, in the realm of space, the syllable āḥ

original: yig dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po //
analyzed: yig dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po //
translated: becomes a red lotus.

original: de'i steng du t'am yig yongs su gyur pa las ka p'a la mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du t'am yig yongs su gyur pa las ka p'a la mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Upon that, the syllable taṃ becomes a skull cup endowed with characteristics.

original: de'i steng du h'um yig sngon po yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um yig sngon po yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Upon that, the blue syllable hūṃ

original: gri gug sngon po h'um gis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: gri gug sngon po h'um gis mtshan pa'o //
translated: becomes a flaying knife marked with hūṃ.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rang nyid rje btsun ma au gra t'a ra nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rang nyid rje btsun ma au gra t'a ra nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: That completely transforms into oneself as Venerable Ugraḍākinī,

original: sku mdog sngon mo 'jigs su rung ba /
analyzed: sku mdog sngon mo 'jigs su rung ba /
translated: blue in color, terrifying,

original: mi mgo rlon pa'i phreng ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mi mgo rlon pa'i phreng ba dang ldan pa /
translated: wearing a garland of fresh human heads,

original: zhabs g-yas bskum zhing g-yon brkyang pa /
analyzed: zhabs g-yas bskum zhing g-yon brkyang pa /
translated: right leg extended and left drawn in,

original: sku lus sbom thung /
analyzed: sku lus sbom thung /
translated: with a stout body,

original: gsus khyim che ba /
analyzed: gsus khyim che ba /
translated: a large belly,

original: autpala'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: autpala'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with an utpala garland,

original: zhal gcig ma ;
analyzed: zhal gcig ma ;
translated: with one face,

original: lha'i gzugs can ma /
analyzed: lha'i gzugs can ma /
translated: having a divine form,

original: bzhad pa'i gad rgyangs can /
analyzed: bzhad pa'i gad rgyangs can /
translated: with a laughing, boisterous sound,

original: dgyes par mdzad ma /
analyzed: dgyes par mdzad ma /
translated: delighting in passion,

original: ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: standing on a corpse seat.

original: klu chen po brgyad kyis nyes bar brgyan pa /
analyzed: klu chen po brgyad kyis nyes bar brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with the eight great nāgas.

original: spyan gsum dmar la zlum pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum dmar la zlum pa /
translated: Her three eyes are red and round.

original: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
translated: She wears a tiger-skin skirt.

original: lang tsho gzhon sha dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lang tsho gzhon sha dang ldan pa /
translated: She is endowed with youthful flesh.

original: phyag rgya lngas yang dag par brgyan pa /🔽ljags 'dril ba /
analyzed: phyag rgya lngas yang dag par brgyan pa / ljags 'dril ba /
translated: She is perfectly adorned with the five symbolic ornaments.🔽Her tongue is curled.

original: mche ba drag tu gtsigs pa /
analyzed: mche ba drag tu gtsigs pa /
translated: She bares her fangs fiercely.

original: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis gri sug dang / thod pa thugs kar 'dzin cing /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis gri sug dang / thod pa thugs kar 'dzin cing /
translated: Her two principal hands hold a flaying knife and skull cup at her heart.

original: 'og ma gnyis kyis ral gri dang / autpala 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'og ma gnyis kyis ral gri dang / autpala 'dzin pa /
translated: Her two lower hands hold a sword and utpala.

original: dmar ser dang ldan pa'i ral pa gcig ma'i khrod na rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pas dbu brgyan par gyur pa'i lha mo'i skur bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dmar ser dang ldan pa'i ral pa gcig ma'i khrod na rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pas dbu brgyan par gyur pa'i lha mo'i skur bsam par bya'o //
translated: She has a single red-orange lock of hair, and in its midst is the lord of the family, Akṣobhya, crowning her head.

original: de ltar lha mo'i skur bsgom pa nyams su blangs pa nyid kyis sgrub pa po ni snyan dngags mkhan chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar lha mo'i skur bsgom pa nyams su blangs pa nyid kyis sgrub pa po ni snyan dngags mkhan chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: The practitioner who practices the meditation on the goddess’s form in this way will become a great poet.

original: de nas bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Then do the recitation:

original: hr'im tr'im h'um phad /
analyzed: hr'im tr'im h'um phad /
translated: HRIH TRI HŪṃ PHAT

original: ces pa snying ga'i gnas su 'od zer rnam pa lnga dang ldan par bsams nas /
analyzed: ces pa snying ga'i gnas su 'od zer rnam pa lnga dang ldan par bsams nas /
translated: Having contemplated the five-colored light rays in the heart center,

original: yi ge rnams kyi 'od zer lngas mi shes pa'i bud shing bsregs shing /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi 'od zer lngas mi shes pa'i bud shing bsregs shing /
translated: one should contemplate that the five-colored light rays of the syllables burn the firewood of ignorance

original: ye shes kyi snang ba bskyed par bsam mo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba bskyed par bsam mo //
translated: and generate the appearance of pristine consciousness.

original: g-yas ral gri'i gnas su mi rus kyi phreng ba 'chang bar mos la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas ral gri'i gnas su mi rus kyi phreng ba 'chang bar mos la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that one wears a garland of human bone in the place of a sword and do the recitation.

original: de ltar 'di'i sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas ba tsam gyis 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi gsung gi dbang phyug thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas ba tsam gyis 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi gsung gi dbang phyug thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely reciting this mantra one hundred thousand times, one will obtain the lordship of Mañjughoṣa’s speech.

original: 'od zer spro bsdu'i sbyor ba nyid kyis yid rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag la bsgom zhing /
analyzed: 'od zer spro bsdu'i sbyor ba nyid kyis yid rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag la bsgom zhing /
translated: One should meditate with the mind equipoised in single-pointed concentration by the method of emanating and gathering light rays.

original: rang nyid snyan dngags mkhan chen po'i rig pa'i gnas lnga pa chen @92b po'i pandi ta yin snyam du nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: rang nyid snyan dngags mkhan chen po'i rig pa'i gnas lnga pa chen @92b po'i pandi ta yin snyam du nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that one is a great poet, a paṇḍita of the five great sciences.

original: de ltar bsgom pa la rtse gcig tu gnas pa nyid kyis the tshom med par snyan dngags mkhan chen po dang / gnas lnga pa'i pandi ta chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa la rtse gcig tu gnas pa nyid kyis the tshom med par snyan dngags mkhan chen po dang / gnas lnga pa'i pandi ta chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: By abiding one-pointedly in this meditation, one will become a great poet and a great paṇḍita in the five fields of knowledge without a doubt.

original: gtor ma gtong bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gtor ma gtong bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to offer a bali,

original: gtor ma bsang sbyangs nas /
analyzed: gtor ma bsang sbyangs nas /
translated: purify and cleanse the bali.

original: a'a:las byung ba'i thod pa aom a'a:h'um las byung ba'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bsams la /
analyzed: a'a:las byung ba'i thod pa aom a'a:h'um las byung ba'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bsams la /
translated: From A arises a skull-cup, and in it imagine the nectar of timeless awareness arising from Oṃ Aḥ Hūṃ.

original: sngags 'di nyid kyis gtor ma dbul lo //
analyzed: sngags 'di nyid kyis gtor ma dbul lo //
translated: Offer the bali with this mantra.

original: aom hr'i:ae ka dza te /
analyzed: aom hr'i:ae ka dza te /
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ ekajaṭe

original: ma ma au pa n'i t'a ya /
analyzed: ma ma au pa n'i t'a ya /
translated: māma upanītāya

original: sarba satv'a n'am /
analyzed: sarba satv'a n'am /
translated: sarvasattvānām

original: sh'antim ku ru /
analyzed: sh'antim ku ru /
translated: śāntikaṃ kuru

original: pushtim ku ru /
analyzed: pushtim ku ru /
translated: puṣṭikaṃ kuru

original: raksham ku ru /
analyzed: raksham ku ru /
translated: rakṣaṃ kuru

original: mah'a taksha ka /
analyzed: mah'a taksha ka /
translated: mahātakṣaka

original: n'a g'a dhi pa ta ye /
analyzed: n'a g'a dhi pa ta ye /
translated: nāgādhipate

original: ai mam ba lim grihna grihna grihna pa ya grihna pa ya ba ra bi dy'a karsha ya karsha ya /🔽tra ta tra ta /🔽tstshe da tstshe da /
analyzed: ai mam ba lim grihna grihna grihna pa ya grihna pa ya ba ra bi dy'a karsha ya karsha ya / tra ta tra ta / tstshe da tstshe da /
translated: imaṃ baliṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya varada vidyākarṣaya karṣaya🔽trata trata🔽caṭa caṭa

original: tstshe da ya tstshe da ya /
analyzed: tstshe da ya tstshe da ya /
translated: caṭāpaya caṭāpaya

original: aom a'a:h'um phad sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um phad sv'ah'a /
translated: oṃ aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: zhes pa lan gsum mam bdun gyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa lan gsum mam bdun gyis so //
translated: Say this three or seven times.

original: mchod pas mchod nas /
analyzed: mchod pas mchod nas /
translated: Having made offerings,🔽[the yogin] praises [Tārā] with the following:

original: h'um gi yi ge las byung sngo zhing spom thung ral pa'i thor tshugs ldan //
analyzed: h'um gi yi ge las byung sngo zhing spom thung ral pa'i thor tshugs ldan //
translated: Blue, stout, with a topknot of matted locks arisen from the syllable hūṃ,

original: g-yon brgyad mchog gis mi ro mnan cing mi bzad mchog gi gad rgyangs can //
analyzed: g-yon brgyad mchog gis mi ro mnan cing mi bzad mchog gi gad rgyangs can //
translated: pressing down on the corpse of a man with her eight left feet, laughing a terrible, supreme laugh,

original: ral gri autpala dang ni gri gug thod 'dzin klu chen rgyan dang ldan //
analyzed: ral gri autpala dang ni gri gug thod 'dzin klu chen rgyan dang ldan //
translated: holding a sword, utpala, flaying knife, and skull-cup, adorned with ornaments of great nāgas,

original: 'gro ba'i mi shes mun pa 'joms mdzad sgrol ma drag mo khyod la 'dud //🔽ces pas bstod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mi shes mun pa 'joms mdzad sgrol ma drag mo khyod la 'dud // ces pas bstod do //
translated: I bow to you, Tārā, fierce one, who conquers the darkness of ignorance of migrators.

original: gal te dngos dang rmi lam la sogs par 'byung po dang / sha za 'jigs su rung ba dang / bud med shin tu rid pa dang / sprul la sogs pas 'tshe ba dang / yid mi phebs pa dang / bsgrub snying mi 'dod pa rnams byung na gegs yin pas /
analyzed: gal te dngos dang rmi lam la sogs par 'byung po dang / sha za 'jigs su rung ba dang / bud med shin tu rid pa dang / sprul la sogs pas 'tshe ba dang / yid mi phebs pa dang / bsgrub snying mi 'dod pa rnams byung na gegs yin pas /
translated: If in actuality or in dreams and so forth, there are disturbances by terrifying bhūtas, piśācas, emaciated women, snakes, and so forth, or if there is a lack of confidence and a lack of desire to practice, these are obstacles.

original: 'di'i gtor sngags kyis gtor ma gtong zhing ;
analyzed: 'di'i gtor sngags kyis gtor ma gtong zhing ;
translated: Therefore, one should offer a bali with the bali mantra of this [Tārā].

original: rje btsun lha mo'i rnal 'byor la yid brtan pas thams cad stong pa nyid du bsam zhing /
analyzed: rje btsun lha mo'i rnal 'byor la yid brtan pas thams cad stong pa nyid du bsam zhing /
translated: With a firm mind in the yoga of the venerable goddess, one should imagine everything as emptiness.

original: nya ngan ba dang / bag tsha ba nyid du mi bya'o //
analyzed: nya ngan ba dang / bag tsha ba nyid du mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be depressed or fearful.

original: de dag thams cad rang bzhin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rang bzhin par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of them will be natural.

original: sgrub pa po yid spro ba dang / sems dpa' ba dang / bsgrub pa la blo brtan pa dang / rmi lam du ma dang / sring mo dang / rje mo la sogs pa'i bud med rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lus sbom zhing brjid pa dang /🔽dri ngad ldan pa la sogs pa'i bud med kyi chogs kyis phyag mtshan bu sti la sogs pa ster ba dang / rang gis rnyed pa dang / nyi zla shar @93a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa po yid spro ba dang / sems dpa' ba dang / bsgrub pa la blo brtan pa dang / rmi lam du ma dang / sring mo dang / rje mo la sogs pa'i bud med rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lus sbom zhing brjid pa dang / dri ngad ldan pa la sogs pa'i bud med kyi chogs kyis phyag mtshan bu sti la sogs pa ster ba dang / rang gis rnyed pa dang / nyi zla shar @93a * //
translated: For the practitioner, enthusiasm, courage, a firm mind in practice, and in dreams, a group of women such as one’s mother, sister, or wife adorned with ornaments, with a full, voluptuous body,

original: ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ni grub pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ni grub pa'i rtags so //
translated: with a fragrant scent, and so on, offering one’s hand implements such as a skull cup and so on, one’s own discovery, the rising of the sun and moon, and so on, are signs of accomplishment.

original: rjes su yi ge brgya pas nongs ba bshags shing /
analyzed: rjes su yi ge brgya pas nongs ba bshags shing /
translated: One should confess faults with the one-hundred-syllable mantra.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad dang thun mong du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad dang thun mong du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: One should dedicate the roots of virtue to all sentient beings.

original: lha mo'i nga rgyal la gnas pas spyod lam thams cad yongs su bskyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i nga rgyal la gnas pas spyod lam thams cad yongs su bskyang bar bya'o //
translated: One should maintain all activities with the pride of the goddess.

original: lha mo au gra t'a ra'i sgrub thabs rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta chen po shr'i ba na ras na'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lha mo au gra t'a ra'i sgrub thabs rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta chen po shr'i ba na ras na'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Goddess Ugradevī composed by the great Indian eastern paṇḍita Śrī Bhavabhadra is complete.

original: // / pandi ta de nyid dang chos 'khor lo ts'a ba 'jam dpal ye shes zhes bya bas dpal 'khor bde chen du bsgyur cing zhus pa'o;/
analyzed: // / pandi ta de nyid dang chos 'khor lo ts'a ba 'jam dpal ye shes zhes bya bas dpal 'khor bde chen du bsgyur cing zhus pa'o;/
translated: It was translated and revised by the paṇḍita himself and the translator Jampal Yeshé.
